name: ClipFactory Python - AI Video Processing
description: Advanced AI-powered video processing service with speaker detection, audio-visual analysis, and intelligent clip generation. Optimized for GPU acceleration with CUDA support.
docker_options: -p 8000:8000 -e FLASK_ENV=production -e FLASK_DEBUG=false -e CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0 -e NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=all -e NVIDIA_DRIVER_CAPABILITIES=compute,utility -e CLIPPER_MAX_WORKERS=4 -e FFMPEG_PATH=ffmpeg --shm-size=2g

environment_variables.name: R2_ENDPOINT_URL
environment_variables.description: Cloudflare R2 endpoint URL for storage

environment_variables.name: R2_BUCKET_NAME
environment_variables.description: R2 bucket name for file storage

environment_variables.name: OPENAI_API_KEY
environment_variables.description: OpenAI API key for transcription services

environment_variables.name: GROQ_API_KEY
environment_variables.description: Groq API key for fast transcription

environment_variables.name: CLIPPER_MAX_WORKERS
environment_variables.description: Maximum worker threads for video processing

on_start_script:
#!/bin/bash

# ClipFactory Python Setup Script
echo 'ğŸš€ Starting ClipFactory Python setup...'

# Update system
apt-get update
apt-get install -y git curl wget python3 python3-pip ffmpeg

# Clone repository
cd /workspace
if [ ! -d 'clipfactory-python' ]; then
    git clone https://github.com/yourusername/clipfactory-python.git
fi
cd clipfactory-python

# Install Python dependencies
pip3 install -r requirements.txt

# Install PyTorch with CUDA support
pip3 install torch torchvision torchaudio --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu121

# Install additional ML packages
pip3 install ultralytics mediapipe-silicon librosa soundfile

# Create necessary directories
mkdir -p temp uploads downloads

# Download YOLO model
python3 -c "from ultralytics import YOLO; YOLO('yolov8n.pt')"

# Set environment variables in system
echo 'export FLASK_ENV=production' >> /etc/environment
echo 'export FLASK_DEBUG=false' >> /etc/environment
echo 'export CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0' >> /etc/environment
echo 'export CLIPPER_MAX_WORKERS=4' >> /etc/environment

# Start the application
echo 'ğŸ¬ Starting ClipFactory service...'
cd /workspace/clipfactory-python
python3 app.py &

# Wait and check health
sleep 30
if curl -f http://localhost:8000/status/health > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo 'âœ… ClipFactory is running successfully!'
    echo 'ğŸŒ Service available at: http://localhost:8000'
else
    echo 'âŒ Service failed to start. Check logs.'
fi

echo 'ğŸ‰ Setup complete!'
readme:
# ClipFactory Python - AI Video Processing

## Overview
Advanced AI-powered video processing service that combines audio-visual analysis with intelligent speaker detection to generate engaging video clips.

## Features
- ğŸ¯ **Smart Speaker Detection**: Advanced audio-visual analysis to identify and focus on active speakers
- ğŸ¬ **Intelligent Cropping**: Automatic video cropping with speaker tracking
- ğŸµ **Multi-Modal Analysis**: Combines audio energy, lip movement, and visual cues
- âš¡ **GPU Accelerated**: Optimized for CUDA-enabled GPUs
- ğŸ”„ **Batch Processing**: Efficient processing of multiple video clips
- ğŸ“Š **Real-time Progress**: WebSocket-based progress tracking

## API Endpoints
- `POST /process` - Start video processing job
- `GET /status/<job_id>` - Check job status and progress
- `GET /status/health` - Health check endpoint

## Required Environment Variables
- `R2_ENDPOINT_URL` - Cloudflare R2 storage endpoint
- `R2_ACCESS_KEY_ID` - R2 access key
- `R2_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY` - R2 secret key
- `R2_BUCKET_NAME` - R2 bucket name
- `OPENAI_API_KEY` - OpenAI API key (optional)
- `GROQ_API_KEY` - Groq API key (optional)

## GPU Requirements
- **Minimum**: 8GB VRAM
- **Recommended**: 16GB+ VRAM
- **CUDA**: 12.1 or compatible

## Usage
1. Set required environment variables
2. Send POST request to `/process` with video URL
3. Monitor progress via `/status/<job_id>`
4. Download processed clips from provided URLs

## Support
For issues or questions, please check the repository documentation.
